body: --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/toxic/89)

comment_regular_data.body:
Re-built toxic with newest changes. Ctrl+Arrows still do nothing.

In addition, Ctrl+P is now broken. When I press Ctrl+P nothing happens. However, when I press Ctrl+P followed by any key, then the original Ctrl+P functionality gets triggered.

Surprisingly, Ctrl+O works fine.

> Re-built toxic with newest changes. Ctrl+Arrows still do nothing.
> 
> In addition, Ctrl+P is now broken. When I press Ctrl+P nothing happens. However, when I press Ctrl+P followed by any key, then the original Ctrl+P functionality gets triggered.
> 
> Surprisingly, Ctrl+O works fine.

That's strange, I guess the hack I wrote for manual key sequence detection isn't portable. So much for that idea. I think we're just going to have to live with it not working on some systems

Edit: Ctrl+p not working in docker is an old bug unrelated to this PR. I've tested this PR in konsole/docker with and without tmux, and it seems to work fine. Could you double check that you have the latest commit and recompiled?

>Could you double check that you have the latest commit and recompiled?

```
commit e428879bebb964a0435414ce00add7ffb2253ade (HEAD -> JFreegman-word-skip)
```

Tested it outside docker.

Ctrl+P works properly when run outside of docker.

Ctrl+arrows still don't work for me, tested in konsole, xterm and tty, all outside of docker.

Well, it doesn't seem like that PR breaks anything as far as I can tell, so I don't see any downsides to merging it.

commit.message: Add ability to skip words in input field with ctrl-left/right arrow

commit.message:
Manually attempt to decode input char sequences

This is currently a fallback method for when the terminal doesn't
detect ctrl arrow sequences, but it is generalized for future additions

commit.message:
Fix clashing key bindings

Scrolling the groupchat peer list now uses ctrl+up and down

Fix clashing key bindings

Scrolling the groupchat peer list now uses ctrl+up and down
